title: PM phone call with Indian Prime Minister: 16 June 2016

details.body:
Following the phone call a Downing Street spokesperson said:

The Prime Minister spoke to the Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi this morning about India’s application for membership of the Nuclear Suppliers Group, a group of nuclear supplier countries that works together to prevent nuclear proliferation by controlling the export of materials, equipment and technology that can be used to manufacture nuclear weapons.

The Prime Minister confirmed that the UK would firmly support India’s application. They agreed that in order for the bid to be successful it would be important for India to continue to strengthen its non-proliferation credentials, including by reinforcing the separation between civil and military nuclear activity.

They agreed the UK-India relationship was going from strength to strength, including through the recent visit of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge.

description: David Cameron spoke to the Indian PM Narendra Modi this morning about India’s application for membership of the Nuclear Suppliers Group.

available_translations.title: PM phone call with Indian Prime Minister: 16 June 2016
available_translations.description: David Cameron spoke to the Indian PM Narendra Modi this morning about India’s application for membership of the Nuclear Suppliers Group.

available_translations.title: ब्रिटिश प्रधानमंत्री ने भारतीय प्रधानमंत्री को फोन किया: 16 जून 2016
available_translations.description: श्री डेविड कैमरन ने आज सुबह प्रधानमंत्री श्री नरेंद्र मोदी से फोन पर न्यूक्लियर सप्लायर ग्रुप के लिए भारत की सदस्यता आवेदन के मुद्दे पर चर्चा की।

available_translations.title: وزیراعظم کی بھارتی وزیراعظم سے ٹیلی فون پرگفتگو: 16جون 2016ء
available_translations.description: ڈیوڈ کیمرون نے بھارتی وزیراعظم نریندرمودی سے آج صبح ٹیلی فون پر جوہری سپلائیرزگروپ میں بھارت کی رکنیت کی درخواست کے بارے میں گفتگو کی ہے.
